titleStmt.title: Thomas E. Bramlette, Justice of the Peace, Garner Parmley
CWG1754

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
IN THE NAME AND BY THE AUTHORITY OF
The Commonwealth of Kentucky,
KENTUCKY
UNITED WE STAND, DIVIDED WE FALLTHOMAS E. BRAMLETTE,
GOVERNOR OF SAID COMMONWEALTH.
To all whom these Presents shall come, Greeting:

Know Ye, That Garner Parmley having been duly appointed JUSTICE OF THE PEACE, for Wayne County, in District, No. four, until his successor chosen at the next august election shall qualify. No election having been held in said district for justice of the peace at last May election, I hereby invest him with full power and authority to execute and discharge the duties of the said office according to law: And to have and to hold the same, with all the rights and emoluments thereunto legally appertaining, until his successor is duly qualified according to law.

In Testimony Whereof, I have caused these letters to be made patent and the Seal of the Commonwealth to be hereunto affixed. Done at Frankfort, the 5th day of January, in the year of our Lord, one thousand eight hundred and Sixty four, and in the 72d year of the Commonwealth.

Tho E Bramlette
BY THE GOVERNOR:
E L VanWinkle, Secretary of State.
Commonwealth Office -- WM. E. HUGHES, State Printer.
Wayne Co
Comr
cancelled
J. P.
